comment: Class is lockdown but no webcam and the grading and material is pretty easy to follow. This class is structured pretty well. I would take any closs this professor is teaching.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment:
TAKE HIM! Easy class. 2 individual papers and 3 or 4 group projects. Quiz every week that is open book no lockdown. Tests are lockdown no camera. 3 Group discussion posts. Most info comes from the book so read it. 
The work is time consuming but easy. Easy A if you stay on top of it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: The quizzes are easy. The group project requires some effort. The discussion posts and papers are time-consuming but not complicated, and he is not a harsh grader.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Gnuse was a tough but fair professor. There is definitely a fair amount of work in this class, but as long as you stay on top of it you should do well. He has high expectations for his students but is very kind and wants you to do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Accessible outside class

comment: 3 individual papers that are pretty easy. 2 tests that were pretty easy. 1 group project that was fairly easy on a case study. Discussion posts are pretty easy too. Clear grading criteria. He can be a little picky while grading papers but still fair. Pretty easy online class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Gnuse gives a lot of homework. 5 discussions posts. 3 case study papers, 2 group project assignments and 3 tests. He provides an specific grade rubric, however he does provide good feedback. I wrote my papers in this class than my English classes . Take him if you're willing to do the workload.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--So many papers

comment: 6 discussion. Group project. Midterm & Final. He likes to take off a few points on discussions for stupid things. overall easy A. I took this class just for credit to graduate and I'll be finishing it with a high A. Online class is super easy. Discussion due thursdays, responses due sunday.

Expects a very detailed answer to discussion posts and to cite APA. Received 93 on all my papers so far and a high A on 1st test but they were not easy. You really have to put in the work in to get the grade. The test was timed & I finished with 12 sec to spare w/ 5 discussions Q must cite. I will upload papers to coursehero so you can see grading

Course is well organized and lectures are interesting. Professor is very involved in online discussions which require you read 80% of all posts. Amount of written project work, absurd level of spoon-feeding on expectations and nit-picky grading was a huge disappointment in upper level ETHICS course. Extra credit, easy exams. But, I don't recommend!

Class was okay. Tests were mixed with multiple choice and long-answer questions. Most multiple choice answers can be found on Google. Gives guidelines on what he expects and if you miss one he will take considerable points off. Very strict on having all documents submitted in the name format he requires. Alright class, but requires a lot of time.

Tests were 90 minute all essay, 7 questions, open book, required that you cite your sources correctly durring the essay. I learend a lot more about grammer and punctuation then I did about anything ethical. The writting assignment requirements were a bit confusing but not impossible and he was very responsive to questions.  Would not take again

I would recommend taking Professor Gnuse online.  Minimal amount of work and it is a fairly easy class.  You had quizzes each week that go towards your grade.  3 online tests with multiple choice and 1 short answer.  Group discussion each unit that are mainly based on participation.  Easy  A.

Gnuse graded assignments more on the format than the content. Follow his formatting exactly and you should do fine. Being off just a little, even the title as a saved document can cause a loss of 5 or more points. Overall, very lenient on due dates, but a bit of a brute when talking directly.

This guy gives work that distracts from learning the material. The tests answers don't always agree with the textbook (your primary source for the info). He took points off of an assignment for something not in the requirements, then went back and changed the requirements after the due date to shield himself from student flack.

Very nice professor. Took online. Would recommend him. Used book just to read chapters. Had group work in an online class (yuck). Just a couple of group papers and online discussions. Quizzes,exams & final online.

Took online, which was a huge mistake. Absolutely horrible. Incredible amounts of busywork and awful tests that are almost impossible to get an A on even WITH the book in front of you. No amounts of studying helped me. Avoid taking online.

Online class. So. Much. Work. There is at least one assignment/discussion/paper due each week. Also 2 smaller group papers and 1 big one in the semester. I have 18 graded things in this class with 5 assignments and a final to go. I never get full credit either, 2 points off usually. But he is responsive to emails. Overall annoying amounts of work.

He does everything ok it's just all the XXXXXXX HOMEWORK!!! OMG I did more XXXX in this one class then in all my others... the guy needs to relax! I would take him again because he easy to understand.
Easy A, don't always have to go to class, just make sure you do the case studies and get your group project done, he grades pretty easy

Papa Gnouche reminded us of Jeff Foxworthy! He's great though, sort of unclear, but generally very easy A. IB is my major, though, and I wish I had learned more. 1 midterm and a final exam (non comprehensive). Several case analysis assignments with little direction, but easy grader. 1 large, country report and presentation at the end of term.
